definition: reluctant to admit a mistake
mouth/beak/nozzle/spout (of teapot etc)/CL:張|张[zhang1],個|个[ge4]
hard/stiff/strong/firm/resolutely/doggedly/good (quality)/able (person)/(of food) filling/substantial
see 刀子嘴，豆腐心[dao1 zi5 zui3 , dou4 fu5 xin1]

sentences.english: So, do all banks have moats?
sentences.chinese: 這樣，所有的銀行都嘴硬？

sentences.english: The east doesnt hurt to be so stubborn, in order to gauge elim dont want to let him die.
sentences.chinese: 東方不敗嘴硬的說是爲了儀琳不想讓他死。

sentences.english: Although Tang Li mouth shut to him but he knew that this contract is important.
sentences.chinese: 唐力雖然嘴硬但他知道這份合約對他的重要。
某人真是嘴硬，“誰說我累了？

sentences.english: Dai Yaya mouth shut, said he lived this quite good.
sentences.chinese: 戴亞亞嘴硬，說自己住這挺好的。

definition: to retort/to answer back
Death is near at hand. (idiom)
duplicity/hypocrisy (idiom)
to admit defeat/to give in/to acknowledge a mistake/to apologize/to be amenable to persuasion
to quibble
to regard face as all-important/to consider loss of face unthinkable
to argue strenuously or with sophistry/to quibble
to twist words and force logic (idiom)/sophistry/loud rhetoric making up for fallacious argument/shoving false arguments down people's throats
lit. show strength while weak inside (idiom); appearing fierce while cowardly at heart/a sheep in wolf's clothing
to act stupid/to play dumb/to pretend to not know
to act shamelessly/to behave in a way that leaves others tut-tutting and shaking their heads in disapproval
not to overlook, nor spare (idiom); unwilling to forgive/to treat severely without listening to excuses
to pester endlessly (idiom)/an annoying troublemaker
to fly into a rage out of humiliation/to be ashamed into anger (idiom)
to boast shamelessly/to talk big
to beg forgiveness
